p: Spots in gels were classified into conserved and differential, according to IP and MW data. A spot was regarded as conserved when identical IP and MW values were determined for it in at least two cultures ( Fig 2B), and a spot was considered as differential when no matching IP and MW values were found in other cultures ( Fig 2C). Interestingly, at least one-third of protein spots were conserved among cysticercus cultures.
